page.title: 03ST.JOHN'S CHURCH, BROMSGROVE
page.content: {St.John's Church}was built between the 12th and 15th centuries. It is a fine sandstone church with a west tower and a beautiful{spire}built in the 14th century. In the spire are ten bells which date from 1701 to 1816.The church was restored by Sir Gilbert Scott in 1858. It is sited on a hill looking down on the town. It has got a gate called the{Lychgate}with 42 steps leading up to it. In the graveyard there are some very famous tombstones. There are two about a train accident in 1840. The engine was going up the Lickey incline and the force was too much for the boiler and it exploded, killing the two engine drivers.
